com.defano.jmonet.tools

Class RotateTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.PaintTool
      • com.defano.jmonet.tools.base.AbstractSelectionTool
        • com.defano.jmonet.tools.RotateTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanvasCommitObserver, SurfaceInteractionObserver, MutableSelection, TransformableSelection, MarchingAntsObserver, KeyListener, EventListener

    public class RotateTool
extends AbstractSelectionTool
    Tool for selecting a bounding box and free-rotating the selected image about its centerpoint.

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e,
                         Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when a mouse button has been pressed on a component.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e,
                         Point imageLocation)
        Invoked when a mouse button is pressed on a component and then dragged. MOUSE_DRAGGED events will continue to be delivered to the component where the drag originated until the mouse button is released (regardless of whether the mouse position is within the bounds of the component).

        Due to platform-dependent Drag&Drop implementations, MOUSE_DRAGGED events may not be delivered during a native Drag&Drop operation.

        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface SurfaceInteractionObserver
        Overrides:
        mouseDragged in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        e - The mouse event that occurred
        imageLocation - the location (relative to the image) where the event occurred

      • resetSelection

        public void resetSelection()
        Reset the selection boundary to its initial, no-selection state. MutableSelection.getSelectionOutline() should return null following a selection reset, but prior to defining a new selection.

      • setSelectionOutline

        public void setSelectionOutline(Rectangle bounds)
        Specifies the selection rectangle (bounds) of the current selection, i.e., the rectangular path on which "marching ants" will be drawn.
        Parameters:
        bounds - The new selection bounds.

      • addSelectionPoint

        protected void addSelectionPoint(Point initialPoint,
                                 Point newPoint,
                                 boolean isShiftKeyDown)
        Invoked to indicate that the user has defined a new point on the selection path.
        Specified by:
        addSelectionPoint in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        initialPoint - The first point defined by the user (i.e., where the mouse was initially pressed)
        newPoint - A new point to append to the selection path (i.e., where the mouse is now)
        isShiftKeyDown - When true, indicates user is holding the shift key down

      • completeSelection

        public void completeSelection(Point finalPoint)
        Invoked to indicate that the given point should be considered the last point in the selection path.
        Specified by:
        completeSelection in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Parameters:
        finalPoint - The final point on the selection path.

      • getSelectionOutline

        public Shape getSelectionOutline()
        Gets the bounding selection shape of the current selection outline, i.e., the path on which "marching ants" will be drawn.
        Returns:
        The selection outline

      • adjustSelectionBounds

        public void adjustSelectionBounds(int xDelta,
                                  int yDelta)
        Invoked to indicate that the selection should be moved on the canvas and therefore the selection shape's coordinates should be translated accordingly.
        Parameters:
        xDelta - Number of pixels to move selection bounds horizontally.
        yDelta - Number of pixels to move selection bounds vertically.

      • getSelectedImageLocation

        protected Point getSelectedImageLocation()
        Returns the location (top-left x,y coordinates) on the canvas where the selected image should be drawn. Typically, this is the location of the selection shape.

        However, for tools that mutate the selection shape (i.e., RotateTool), this location may need to be adjusted to account for changes to the selection shape's bounds.

        Overrides:
        getSelectedImageLocation in class AbstractSelectionTool
        Returns:
        The x,y coordinate where the selected image should be drawn on the canvas.

      • redrawSelection

        public void redrawSelection()
        Clears the scratch buffer then draws the selected image and selection outline ("marching ants") onto it.
        Specified by:
        redrawSelection in interface MutableSelection
        Overrides:
        redrawSelection in class AbstractSelectionTool
